page.title: 15Attitudes in Pencombe
page.content: Generally the villagers attitude is that they are lucky to live in such a friendly and attractive area. Those with families consider it a good place to grow up in with its own school and well away from the main road. Privacy is possible if you want it but the village community is there, yet not intrusive. There is also a feeling of everyone being on a level and getting on well without excluding newcomers who want to become involved in the community. Many people mentioned how friends and neighbours rally round at times of crisis. The only complaints were of the RAF planes flying below the radar screen creating a horrendous noise and of occasional noisy night time car rallies. Even here though, some people saw the planes as a necessary inconvenience, and some of the youngsters loved the car rallies!
